searchHead.title: Search head
searchHead.description: Search Head base URL, can be expression, default is https://localhost:8089.

search.title: Search
search.description: Enter Splunk search here. For example: 'index=myAppLogs level=error channel=myApp' OR '| mstats avg(myStat) as myStat WHERE index=myStatsIndex.'

earliest.title: Earliest
earliest.description: The earliest time boundary for the search. Can be an exact or relative time. For example: '2022-01-14T12:00:00Z' or '-16m@m'

latest.title: Latest
latest.description: The latest time boundary for the search. Can be an exact or relative time. For example: '2022-01-14T12:00:00Z' or '-1m@m'

endpoint.title: Search endpoint
endpoint.description: REST API used to create a search.

value.title: Value
value.description: JavaScript expression to compute the parameter's value, normally enclosed in backticks (e.g., `${earliest}`). If a constant, use single quotes (e.g., 'earliest'). Values without delimiters (e.g., earliest) are evaluated as strings.

value.title: Value
value.description: JavaScript expression to compute the header's value, normally enclosed in backticks (e.g., `${earliest}`). If a constant, use single quotes (e.g., 'earliest'). Values without delimiters (e.g., earliest) are evaluated as strings.

authentication.title: Authentication
authentication.description: Authentication method for Discover and Collect REST calls.

timeout.title: Request Timeout (secs)
timeout.description: HTTP request inactivity timeout, use 0 to disable

useRoundRobinDns.title: Round-robin DNS
useRoundRobinDns.description: Enable to use round-robin DNS lookup. Suitable when DNS server returns multiple addresses in sort order.

disableTimeFilter.title: Disable time filter
disableTimeFilter.description: Used to disable collector event time filtering when a date range is specified.

rejectUnauthorized.title: Reject unauthorized certificates
rejectUnauthorized.description: Whether to reject certificates that cannot be verified against a valid CA (e.g., self-signed certificates).

type.title: Retry type
type.description: The algorithm to use when performing HTTP retries

interval.title: Wait (ms)
interval.description: Time interval between retries. Maximum allowed value is 20,000 ms (1/3 minute).

limit.title: Max retries
limit.description: The maximum number of times to retry a failed HTTP request

codes.title: Retry HTTP codes
codes.description: List of HTTP codes that trigger a retry. Leave empty to use the default list of 429 and 503.

enableHeader.title: Honor Retry-After header
enableHeader.description: Honor any Retry-After header that specifies a delay (in seconds) or a timestamp after which to retry the request. The delay is limited to 20 seconds, even if the Retry-After header specifies a longer delay. When disabled, all Retry-After headers are ignored.

retryConnectTimeout.title: Retry Connection Timeout
retryConnectTimeout.description: When toggled to Yes (the default), there will be a single retry attempt made when a connection timeout (ETIMEDOUT) error occurs

retryConnectReset.title: Retry Connection Reset
retryConnectReset.description: When toggled to Yes (the default), the request will be retried when a connection reset error (ECONNRESET) error occurs

interval.title: Initial retry interval (ms)
interval.description: Time interval between failed request and first retry (kickoff). Maximum allowed value is 20,000 ms (1/3 minute).

limit.title: Max retries
limit.description: The maximum number of times to retry a failed HTTP request

multiplier.title: Backoff multiplier
multiplier.description: Base for exponential backoff, e.g., base 2 means that retries will occur after 2, then 4, then 8 seconds, and so on

codes.title: Retry HTTP codes
codes.description: List of HTTP codes that trigger a retry. Leave empty to use the default list of 429 and 503.

enableHeader.title: Honor Retry-After header
enableHeader.description: Honor any Retry-After header that specifies a delay (in seconds) or a timestamp after which to retry the request. The delay is limited to 20 seconds, even if the Retry-After header specifies a longer delay. When disabled, all Retry-After headers are ignored.

retryConnectTimeout.title: Retry Connection Timeout
retryConnectTimeout.description: When toggled to Yes (the default), there will be a single retry attempt made when a connection timeout (ETIMEDOUT) error occurs

retryConnectReset.title: Retry Connection Reset
retryConnectReset.description: When toggled to Yes (the default), the request will be retried when a connection reset error (ECONNRESET) error occurs

credentialsSecret.title: Credentials secret
credentialsSecret.description: Select (or create) a stored secret that references your credentials

tokenSecret.title: Bearer Token secret
tokenSecret.description: Select (or create) a stored secret that references your Bearer token

loginUrl.title: Login URL
loginUrl.description: URL to use for login API call. This call is expected to be a POST.

loginBody.title: POST Body
loginBody.description: Template for POST body to send with login request, ${username} and ${password} are used to specify location of these attributes in the message

tokenRespAttribute.title: Token Attribute
tokenRespAttribute.description: Path to token attribute in login response body. Nested attributes are OK.

authHeaderExpr.title: Authorize Expression
authHeaderExpr.description: JavaScript expression to compute the Authorization header to pass in discover and collect calls. The value ${token} is used to reference the token obtained from login.
